intro: Tithymalus trichotomus, commonly known as the three-parted tithymalus, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its aromatic foliage and small, clustered flowers. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 centimeters and prefers well-drained, sandy soils. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive trifoliate structure, while its flowers are white or pale yellow. Tithymalus trichotomus is often used in ornamental gardening for its delicate appearance and fragrant properties.
